section.title: Exit codes
section.para:
When PerfCake terminates normally, the exit code returned to the operating system is 0 as usual. In some cases and to ease automation, there might be a non zero return code depending on the situation. In the following table you can find the codes and their root causes.
In Linux systems, you can obtain the exit code from the $? environment property.

row.entry: No scenario was specified on the command line or via the system property.
Wrong parameters on the command line.
It was not possible to find, parse or load the scenario.
There was a general error during execution of the scenario. This can be caused by incorrect or incompatible configuration parameters.
Some responses to messages did not pass validation.
There were blocked threads after the test execution that was not possible to terminate cleanly. This can be caused by hanging connections or deadlocks in the application under test.
There was an error while replaying a provided test record.
The user requested help/usage information with a command line option and it was printed.
